results.title: Romper stomper
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Wright, Daniel Scharf, Ian Pringle, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria and Seon Films
results.brief_description: This controversial movie is an exploration of a group of skinheads in the Melbourne inner-city suburb of Footscray who are angry at the Asian-Australians who live amongst them. The film’s evasions are obvious: the narrative it explores belongs as much to the outer suburbs as it does to the multi-ethnic inner suburbs. The director’s scripting and characterization is firmly and deliberately humanistic and sentimental; however the representation of some of the characters appears one dimensional and limited. Despite these shortcomings, “Romper Stomper” is an important Australian film in that it raises complicated issues of class, ethnicity, identity and nationalism. Its reception in the rest of the world was much more critical than its reception in Australia. With excellent performances by Russell Crowe, Daniel Pollock and Jacqueline McKenzie.

results.title: Farewell my concubine
results.creator_credit: Chen Kaige, Hsu Feng, Maverick, Miramax Films and Tomson Films
results.brief_description: Chen Kiage’s spellbinding tale of betrayal is as sprawling and colourful as China itself. This awe-inspiring drama centres on the incredible lives of two stars from the Peking opera who find themselves hopelessly entwined in the turbulence of 20th Century China. Twice banned from Chinese cinemas because of the controversial content, this visually stunning film leaves no stone unturned to create a rich and emotionally powerful screen epic. Nominated for the Best Foreign Film Academy Award. Mandarin dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: The Doors
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, A. Kitman Ho, Bill Graham, Sasha Harari, Bill Graham Films and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description: With this biography of rock group The Doors, and in particular the excesses of lead singer and poet Jim Morrison, Oliver Stone’s obesession with documenting the cultural shifts in America in the 1960s found its perfect subject. Val Kilmer is engaging as Morrison, a young film student who becomes attracted to the promise and liberation of acid-tinged Haight-Ashbury. The formation of The Doors coincided with the LSD experimentation and the counter-cultural revolution in the American underground. Stone traces the band’s increasing popularity, their acceptance by the New York avant-garde, including Warhol’s Factory and Morrison’s decline through drug-abuse. As the band falls apart, only Morrison’s identification with Native American spirituality offers an escape from the materialist Hell he is in. This intense and kinetic film is both a celebration of counter-cultural revolution and a sad lament for its corruption. Co-starring Meg Ryan, Kyle MacLachlan, Michael Madsen and a cameo by Billy Idol.

results.title: The Nanny
results.creator_credit: Seth Holt, Jimmy Sangster and Seven Arts-Hammer Film Production
results.brief_description: Bette Davis is mesmerizing as a seemingly devoted, long-suffering Nanny. Ten year old Joey (William Dix) is accused of drowning his younger sister in the bath and is institutionalised for therapy despite claiming that the Nanny was responsible. When he returns home suspicion is aroused when his mother (Wendy Craig) is poisoned and his Aunt suddenly dies. Joey continues to insist the Nanny is responsible and life turns into a deft cat-and-mouse game between the shady woman and her young charge. Co-starring Jill Bennett, James Villiers and Pamela Franklin. Based on the novel “The Nanny” by Evelyn Piper.

results.title: Edward Scissorhands (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Denise Di Novi and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A lonely old inventor in a castle upon a hill dies and leaves his greatest creation, a boy called Edward, unfinished. Instead of hands, the boy has sharp shears of metal. Until his rescue by a kindly Avon lady who takes him home to the pastel paradise of suburbia, Edward lives alone in darkness. “Edward Scissorhands” is more than a fairy tale by masterful director Tim Burton. This is a satire/allegory which is both funny and moving. Johhny Depp as Edward is a gentle creature full of pathos, yet dignified; much less a monster than the fickle humans who at first embrace him and then seek to destroy him. Dianne Weist stars as Avon Lady Peg, and Winona Ryder as her daughter, Kim. The sets are typical of Burton’s famed surreal style. “Edward Scissorhands” is a film of great poignancy with its own special beauty.

results.title: Ladyhawke (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Donner, Lauren Shuler, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A haunting tale of magic and mysticism set in an age of enchantment and adventure. Navarre (Rutger Hauer) and Isabeau (Michelle Pfeiffer) are two lovers, condemned to spend eternity together - yet never touch, transformed by the spell of the corrupt Bishop Aquila. Aided by the young renegade thief, “Phillipe the mouse” (Matthew Broderick) and defrocked priest, Imperius (Leo McKern), they must find a moment in time when night and day are one - and evil consumes itself to break the spell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Donner, Lauren Shuler, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Speed (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jan De Bont, Mark Gordon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Fast moving, action packed and relentless, ‘Speed’ transports the viewer into a world gone mad, as a terrorist “mad bomber” (Dennis Hopper) holds a bus load of innocent passengers to ransom. Keanu Reeves is a SWAT specialist who must ensure that the bus keeps speeding through the streets of Los Angeles at no less than 50mph if the passengers are to stay alive. Co-starring Sandra Bullock and Jeff Daniels.

results.title: Chaplin (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Richard Attenborough, Mario Kassar and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Brilliant, enigmatic, beloved, Charlie Chaplin made more people laugh than anyone else in history. His story and the story of filmmaking are inextricably linked and brought to the screen in Richard Attenborough’s modern masterpiece. This truly magnificent film features one of the finest casts from the world of film and includes: Dan Aykroyd, Geraldine Chaplin, Anthony Hopkins, Marisa Tomei, Kevin Kline and James Woods. This is the story of how this master entertainer survived a deprived and tragic childhood and then transformed such poverty into humour cherished by all.

results.title: The Crying game (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley, Channel Four, Euro Trustees, Nippon Film Development & Finance and Palace Films
results.brief_description: Full of surprises, this film did more than win extraordinary critical acclaim throughout the world. It upstaged the competition by receiving six Academy Award nominations and an Oscar for Best Screenplay. Set in Ireland, this spellbinding thriller involves a black British soldier, Jody (Forest Whittaker), who befriends his reluctant IRA captor, Fergus (Stephen Rea). When Jody is killed in an ambush, Fergus fulfills his dying wish - to find his girlfriend Dil (Jaye Davidson) in England. When Fergus and Dil become romantically involved, the crying game begins. Electrifying and seductive, this is the movie that had everyone talking. Co-starring Miranda Richardson.

results.title: Wuthering Heights (S) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Samuel Goldwyn and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A passionate interpretation of Emily Bronte’s classic Victorian novel starring Laurence Olivier, Merle Oberon, David Niven, Donald Crisp, Flora Robson and Geraldine Fitzgerald.
